summary: The implementation successfully adds trade entry/exit points and stop loss calculations to the OpportunityDetailsPanel component using only frontend Binance data. All four requirements appear to be implemented with proper separation of concerns maintained.

hallucinated_features.reason: The implementation includes direction determination logic and displays 'Long' or 'Short' positions, which was not requested in any of the four requirements. The BuildRequest only asked for entry price, take profit target, and stop loss calculation.

hallucinated_features.description: Confidence scoring and risk/reward ratio calculations
hallucinated_features.reason: The tradeRecommendation.ts module calculates and returns confidence scores and riskRewardRatio values, which were not part of the specified requirements. The requirements focused on price points (entry, exit, stop loss) only.

hallucinated_features.description: Detailed rationale array with multiple technical justifications
hallucinated_features.reason: The implementation generates an array of rationale strings explaining the recommendation based on trend, confidence, strength, and institutional orders. While helpful, this detailed explanation system was not requested in the requirements.

The code implements a comprehensive MODALITY_PARAMS object with six different modality types (scalping, swing, breakout, reversal, smc, fvg) each with specific risk/reward parameters. While REQ-2 mentions 'Target price reflects the opportunity type', the extensive parameter system goes beyond what was specified.
